results.title: Olympic Legacy: this was forever
results.creator_credit: Mark Aitken, First Light and Polkadotsonraindrops
results.brief_description: Set in East London, the location of the 2012 Olympics, this documentary follows a community’s battle to prevent their allotments being swallowed up in the development plans. This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.
results.description: Set in East London, the location of the 2012 Olympics, this documentary follows a community’s battle to prevent their allotments being swallowed up in the development plans. This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.

This powerful film looks at what happens when a diverse group of people are united in despair about the effects of change.

results.title: Double Take
results.creator_credit: Samuel Hodges, Dan Roberts, Sophie Vickers, Arms Around the Child, Channel 4 and Greene Light Films
results.brief_description: Inspired by real-life events, ‘Double Take’ is a story of family rivalry and reconciliation along a trail of forgotten memories.

results.title: Polybius
results.creator_credit: James Houston, Joanne Daly, Bold Yin and Channel 4
results.brief_description: A SEGA Mega Drive, Commodore 64, floppy disk drives and hard drives sing in unison. The unusual ensemble (controlled live via MIDI) is given a last curtain call in a nostalgic farewell to forgotten friends.
results.creator_credit_for_label: James Houston, Joanne Daly, Bold Yin and Channel 4

results.title: Chaps on Tour 2011 [Short version]
results.brief_description: A specially made abridged version of the amazing ‘Chaps On Tour’ film, made by Toby Segar - at the age of just 16. Toby and his six friends set out to capture an image of their lives: fun and friendship driven by their mutual love of Parkour.

results.title: My Grandma
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Taylor, First Light, Smith and Watson Productions and Wide Eyed
results.brief_description: Jamie is a girl who just wants to enjoy herself. However, she is constantly called upon to care for her demanding Grandmother. She is tired of hearing tales of Grandma’s childhood whilst missing out on her own. Successfully demonstrating the difference between two generations of women, will her Grandma’s constant nagging and complaining push Jamie too far?
results.creator_credit_for_label: Geoffrey Taylor, First Light, Smith and Watson Productions and Wide Eyed

results.title: Asking Around
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.brief_description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mike Kenneally, Kim Montgomery, Richard Greenhalgh and ACMI
results.description: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
description_for_label: Shaun Tan (author and co-director)describes some of his original concepts for the book of ‘The Lost Thing’ and how these were translated and changed for the film adaptation. Other interviewees Tom Bryant (3D artist)and Leo Baker (animator)discuss points of similarity and difference between the book and film.
